Created and written by HackXIt <hackxit@gmail.com> (Nikolaus Rieder)
built with pdoc

src.generate

This script contains the generation process pipelines for the LVGL UI Generator project. It depends on version 2 of the generator to work. It will call the Micropython generator script to create UIs based on the provided arguments. The script will generate a dataset of UIs based on the chosen mode (random or design) and their corresponding arguments.

The script may be called according to the following usage information:

usage: generate.py [-h] [-o OUTPUT_FOLDER] [--mpy-path MPY_PATH] [--mpy-main MPY_MAIN] [-d DATASET] [-s SPLIT_RATIO SPLIT_RATIO SPLIT_RATIO] [--no-dataset]
                {random,design} ...

Generate UI Detector dataset

positional arguments:
{random,design}       Type of LVGL UI generator to use
    random              Generate random UI
    design              Generate UI from design files

options:
-h, --help            show this help message and exit
-o OUTPUT_FOLDER, --output-folder OUTPUT_FOLDER
                        Output folder (default: tmp/output)
--mpy-path MPY_PATH   Path to MicroPython binary (loads from environment MICROPYTHON_BIN if not provided) (default: )
--mpy-main MPY_MAIN   Path to main.py of micropython script (loads from environment MICROPYTHON_MAIN if not provided) (default: )
-d DATASET, --dataset DATASET
                        Custom name of the dataset written in the task comment (default: )
-s SPLIT_RATIO SPLIT_RATIO SPLIT_RATIO, --split-ratio SPLIT_RATIO SPLIT_RATIO SPLIT_RATIO
                        Split ratio for train, val, test (default: None)
--no-dataset          Do not create a ClearML dataset (artifacts are added to Task) (default: False)
Subparser 'random'
usage: generate.py random [-h] [-W WIDTH] [-H HEIGHT] [-c COUNT] [-l LAYOUT] [-x AMOUNT]

options:
-h, --help            show this help message and exit
-W WIDTH, --width WIDTH
                        Width of the UI screenshot
-H HEIGHT, --height HEIGHT
                        Height of the UI screenshot
-c COUNT, --count COUNT
                        Number of widgets to create per output
-l LAYOUT, --layout LAYOUT
                        The main container layout of the random UI ["grid", "flex", "none"]
-x AMOUNT, --amount AMOUNT
                        Amount of outputs per widget class to create

Subparser 'design'
usage: generate.py design [-h] {local,remote,gpt} ...

positional arguments:
{local,remote,gpt}  Variant of design generator to use
    local             Generate UIs from local design files
    remote            Generate UIs from remote design files
    gpt               Generate UIs using ChatGPT API

options:
-h, --help          show this help message and exit

   1"""
   2This script contains the generation process pipelines for the LVGL UI Generator project.
   3It depends on version 2 of the generator to work.
   4It will call the Micropython generator script to create UIs based on the provided arguments.
   5The script will generate a dataset of UIs based on the chosen mode (random or design) and their corresponding arguments.
   6
   7The script may be called according to the following usage information:
   8
   9    usage: generate.py [-h] [-o OUTPUT_FOLDER] [--mpy-path MPY_PATH] [--mpy-main MPY_MAIN] [-d DATASET] [-s SPLIT_RATIO SPLIT_RATIO SPLIT_RATIO] [--no-dataset]
  10                    {random,design} ...
  11
  12    Generate UI Detector dataset
  13
  14    positional arguments:
  15    {random,design}       Type of LVGL UI generator to use
  16        random              Generate random UI
  17        design              Generate UI from design files
  18
  19    options:
  20    -h, --help            show this help message and exit
  21    -o OUTPUT_FOLDER, --output-folder OUTPUT_FOLDER
  22                            Output folder (default: tmp/output)
  23    --mpy-path MPY_PATH   Path to MicroPython binary (loads from environment MICROPYTHON_BIN if not provided) (default: )
  24    --mpy-main MPY_MAIN   Path to main.py of micropython script (loads from environment MICROPYTHON_MAIN if not provided) (default: )
  25    -d DATASET, --dataset DATASET
  26                            Custom name of the dataset written in the task comment (default: )
  27    -s SPLIT_RATIO SPLIT_RATIO SPLIT_RATIO, --split-ratio SPLIT_RATIO SPLIT_RATIO SPLIT_RATIO
  28                            Split ratio for train, val, test (default: None)
  29    --no-dataset          Do not create a ClearML dataset (artifacts are added to Task) (default: False)
  30    Subparser 'random'
  31    usage: generate.py random [-h] [-W WIDTH] [-H HEIGHT] [-c COUNT] [-l LAYOUT] [-x AMOUNT]
  32
  33    options:
  34    -h, --help            show this help message and exit
  35    -W WIDTH, --width WIDTH
  36                            Width of the UI screenshot
  37    -H HEIGHT, --height HEIGHT
  38                            Height of the UI screenshot
  39    -c COUNT, --count COUNT
  40                            Number of widgets to create per output
  41    -l LAYOUT, --layout LAYOUT
  42                            The main container layout of the random UI ["grid", "flex", "none"]
  43    -x AMOUNT, --amount AMOUNT
  44                            Amount of outputs per widget class to create
  45
  46    Subparser 'design'
  47    usage: generate.py design [-h] {local,remote,gpt} ...
  48
  49    positional arguments:
  50    {local,remote,gpt}  Variant of design generator to use
  51        local             Generate UIs from local design files
  52        remote            Generate UIs from remote design files
  53        gpt               Generate UIs using ChatGPT API
  54
  55    options:
  56    -h, --help          show this help message and exit
  57"""
  58
  59import argparse
  60

 270"""
 271100 themes that could be applied to user interfaces.
 272It was generated using the GPT model from OpenAI with the prompt "Create a list of 100 themes that could be applied to user interfaces."
 273"""
 274
 275combinations = [(t, c) for t in themes for c in topics]
 276"""
 277All possible combinations of themes and topics for the LVGL UI Generator.
 278With 100 themes and 100 topics, there are 10,000 possible combinations.
 279"""
 280
 281implemented_types = ["arc", 
 282                     "bar", "button", "buttonmatrix", 
 283                     "calendar", "checkbox", 
 284                     "dropdown", 
 285                     "label",
 286                     "roller", 
 287                     "scale", "slider", "spinbox", "switch", 
 288                     "table", "textarea"]
 289"""
 290The implemented and used widget types for the LVGL UI Generator.
 291"""
 292
 293# Generators
 294def capture_random(env: dict, args: argparse.Namespace):
 295    """
 296    **Params:**
 297    - `env` Environment dictionary containing the output folder and Micropython paths
 298    - `args` Arguments containing the width, height, count, layout, and amount of widgets to generate
 299
 300    Calls the Micropython generator using random mode to create a user interface.
 301
 302    In each iteration, the generator is provided with a list of widgets, which it will use to create a randomized UI.
 303    Each generated UI is saved as an JPEG image, with a text file containing the label annotations.
 304
 305    Labels are in the format: "class x y w h" (class is the widget type, x/y are the center coordinates, w/h are the width/height)
 306    Label values are normalized to the range [0.0, 1.0].
 307    After each generation, the contained widgets are counted and their total count is accumulated.
 308    Generation is repeated until the desired threshhold per widget is reached.
 309    Labels will be post-processed immediatly, removing any invalid annotations (out-of-bounds of the window).
 310    The generation process is tracked and reported to the ClearML task.
 311
 312    A histogram is created to show the total amount of widgets generated and the amount of files created.
 313    """
 314    import subprocess, os, shutil
 315    from clearml import Task
 316    import numpy as np
 317    task = Task.current_task()
 318    logger = task.get_logger()
 319    global implemented_types
 320    widgets = {}
 321    for widget in implemented_types:
 322        widgets[widget] = 0
 323    done = False
 324    base_command = [os.path.abspath(env['mpy_path']), os.path.abspath(env['mpy_main']), '-m', 'random', '-o', 'screenshot.jpg', '-W', str(args.width), '-H', str(args.height), '-c', str(args.count), '-l', args.layout, '--normalize']
 325    iteration = 0
 326    errors = 0
 327    files = []
 328    while not done:
 329        iteration += 1
 330        command = base_command + ['-t', *[widget for widget in widgets.keys() if widgets[widget] <= args.amount]]
 331        print(f"Running command: {' '.join(command)}")
 332        gen = subprocess.run(args=command, cwd=os.path.abspath(os.path.curdir), capture_output=True, text=True)
 333        if gen.returncode != 0:
 334            print(f"Failed to generate random UI in iteration {iteration}:\n{gen.stdout}\n{gen.stderr}")
 335            errors += 1
 336            continue
 337        tmp_image = os.path.abspath(os.path.join(os.path.abspath(os.path.curdir), "screenshot.jpg"))
 338        tmp_text = os.path.abspath(os.path.join(os.path.abspath(os.path.curdir), "screenshot.txt"))
 339        if not os.path.exists(tmp_image) or not os.path.exists(tmp_text):
 340            print(f"Failed to find generated random UI files in iteration {iteration}")
 341            errors += 1
 342            continue
 343        gen_image = os.path.abspath(os.path.join(env['output_folder'], f"ui_{iteration}.jpg"))
 344        gen_text = os.path.abspath(os.path.join(env['output_folder'], f"ui_{iteration}.txt"))
 345        try:
 346            shutil.move(tmp_image, gen_image)
 347            shutil.move(tmp_text, gen_text)
 348        except FileNotFoundError as e:
 349            print(f"Failed to move files in iteration {iteration}:\n{tmp_image} -> {gen_image}\n{tmp_text} -> {gen_text}\n{e}")
 350            errors += 1
 351            continue
 352        files.append((gen_image, gen_text))
 353        annotation_errors = []
 354        with open(gen_text, 'r+') as f:
 355            # Each line is in this format: "class x y w h" (Need to grab class)
 356            new_lines = []
 357            for i, line in enumerate(f.readlines()):
 358                widget, x, y, w, h = line.split(' ')
 359                x, y, w, h = float(x), float(y), float(w), float(h)
 360                if any([x < 0.0, y < 0.0, w < 0.0, h < 0.0]) or any([x > 1.0, y > 1.0, w > 1.0, h > 1.0]):
 361                    errors += 1
 362                    print(f"[Line {i}] Invalid bounding box found in annotation file {gen_text} of iteration {iteration}")
 363                    print(f"Removed: {widget} {x} {y} {w} {h}")
 364                    annotation_errors.append(i)
 365                    continue
 366                new_lines.append(line)
 367                if widget in widgets:
 368                    widgets[widget] += 1
 369                else:
 370                    errors += 1
 371                    print(f"[Line {i}] Unknown widget class {widget} found in annotation file of iteration {iteration}")
 372            # NOTE Delete invalid annotations in label file
 373            f.seek(0)
 374            f.writelines(new_lines)
 375            f.truncate()
 376            del new_lines
 377        logger.report_scalar(title='Generator', series='total_widgets', value=sum(widgets.values()), iteration=iteration)
 378        logger.report_scalar(title='Generator', series='errors', value=errors, iteration=iteration)
 379        for widget in widgets:
 380            logger.report_scalar(title='Widget metrics', series=widget, value=widgets[widget], iteration=iteration)
 381        if all([widgets[widget] >= args.amount for widget in widgets]):
 382            done = True
 383    generated_widgets = args.amount * len(implemented_types)
 384    generated_files = len(files)
 385    logger.report_histogram(title='Generated widgets', series='total', values=np.array([[generated_widgets], [generated_files]]), labels=['Widgets', 'Files'], yaxis='Count')
 386    print("Finished generating random UIs")
 387    env['generated_widgets'] = generated_widgets
 388    env['generated_files'] = generated_files
 389    env['files'] = files
 390
 391def capture_design(design_folder: str):
 392    """
 393    **Params:**
 394    - `design_folder` Folder containing the design files to generate UIs from
 395
 396    Calls the Micropython generator using design mode to create a user interface.
 397
 398    In each iteration, the generator is called with a design file from the provided folder.
 399    Each generated UI is saved as an JPEG image, with a text file containing the label annotations.
 400
 401    Labels are in the format: "class x y w h" (class is the widget type, x/y are the center coordinates, w/h are the width/height)
 402    Label values are normalized to the range [0.0, 1.0].
 403    After each generation, the contained widgets are counted and their total count is accumulated.
 404    Generation is repeated until the desired threshhold per widget is reached.
 405    Labels will be post-processed immediatly, removing any invalid annotations (out-of-bounds of the window).
 406    The generation process is tracked and reported to the ClearML task.
 407
 408    A histogram is created to show the total amount of widgets generated and the amount of files created.
 409    """
 410    import subprocess, os, shutil
 411    from clearml import Task
 412    print(f"Capturing designs from {design_folder}...")
 413    task = Task.current_task()
 414    logger = task.get_logger()
 415    design_files = [f for f in os.listdir(design_folder) if os.path.isfile(os.path.join(design_folder, f))]
 416    if len(design_files) == 0:
 417        print(f"No design files found in {design_folder}")
 418        return
 419    widgets = {}
 420    for widget in implemented_types:
 421        widgets[widget] = 0
 422    files = []
 423    errors = 0
 424    logger.report_scalar(title='Generator', series='total_widgets', value=sum(widgets.values()), iteration=0)
 425    logger.report_scalar(title='Generator', series='errors', value=errors, iteration=0)
 426    for widget in widgets:
 427        logger.report_scalar(title='Widget metrics', series=widget, value=widgets[widget], iteration=0)
 428    for i, design_file in enumerate(design_files):
 429        print(f"Iteration: {i+1}/{len(design_files)} - {design_file}")
 430        attempts = 0
 431        success = False
 432        # NOTE Retry mechanism due to possible MemoryErrors when dynamically allocating screenshot data (Trust in the OS to clean up the mess)
 433        while not success and attempts < 4:
 434            print(f"Running design generator on file {design_file}")
 435            gen = subprocess.run([os.path.abspath(env['mpy_path']), os.path.abspath(env['mpy_main']), '-m', 'design', '-o', 'screenshot.jpg', '-f', os.path.abspath(os.path.join(design_folder, design_file)), '--normalize'], cwd=os.path.abspath(os.path.curdir), capture_output=True, text=True)
 436            if gen.returncode != 0:
 437                print(f"Failed to generate UI from design file {design_file}:\n{gen.stdout}\n{gen.stderr}")
 438                attempts += 1
 439                continue
 440            success = True
 441        if not success:
 442            print(f"Failed to generate UI from design file {design_file} after {attempts} attempts")
 443            errors += 1
 444            continue
 445        tmp_image = os.path.abspath(os.path.join(os.path.abspath(os.path.curdir), "screenshot.jpg"))
 446        tmp_text = os.path.abspath(os.path.join(os.path.abspath(os.path.curdir), "screenshot.txt"))
 447        if not os.path.exists(tmp_image) or not os.path.exists(tmp_text):
 448            print(f"Failed to find generated UI files from design file {design_file}")
 449            errors += 1
 450            continue
 451        gen_image = os.path.abspath(os.path.join(env['output_folder'], f"ui_{i}.jpg"))
 452        gen_text = os.path.abspath(os.path.join(env['output_folder'], f"ui_{i}.txt"))
 453        try:
 454            print(f"{design_file} -> {gen_image}")
 455            shutil.move(tmp_image, gen_image)
 456            shutil.move(tmp_text, gen_text)
 457        except FileNotFoundError as e:
 458            print(f"Failed to move files from design file {design_file}:\n{tmp_image} -> {gen_image}\n{tmp_text} -> {gen_text}\n{e}")
 459            errors += 1
 460            continue
 461        files.append((gen_image, gen_text))
 462        annotation_errors = []
 463        with open(gen_text, 'r+') as f:
 464            # Each line is in this format: "class x y w h" (Need to grab class)
 465            new_lines = []
 466            for i, line in enumerate(f.readlines()):
 467                widget, x, y, w, h = line.split(' ')
 468                x, y, w, h = float(x), float(y), float(w), float(h)
 469                if any([x < 0.0, y < 0.0, w < 0.0, h < 0.0]) or any([x > 1.0, y > 1.0, w > 1.0, h > 1.0]):
 470                    errors += 1
 471                    print(f"[Line {i}] Invalid bounding box found in annotation file of {design_file}")
 472                    print(f"Removed: {widget} {x} {y} {w} {h}")
 473                    annotation_errors.append(i)
 474                    continue
 475                new_lines.append(line)
 476                if widget in widgets:
 477                    widgets[widget] += 1
 478                else:
 479                    errors += 1
 480                    print(f"[Line {i}] Unknown widget class {widget} found in annotation file of {design_file}")
 481            # NOTE Delete invalid annotations in label file
 482            f.seek(0)
 483            f.writelines(new_lines)
 484            f.truncate()
 485            del new_lines
 486        logger.report_scalar(title='Generator', series='total_widgets', value=sum(widgets.values()), iteration=i+1)
 487        logger.report_scalar(title='Generator', series='errors', value=errors, iteration=i+1)
 488        for widget in widgets:
 489            logger.report_scalar(title='Widget metrics', series=widget, value=widgets[widget], iteration=i+1)
 490    generated_files = len(files)
 491    env['generated_files'] = generated_files
 492    env['files'] = files
 493
 494# Dataset helpers
 495def replace_class_names(files: list):
 496    """
 497    **Params:**
 498    - `files` List of tuples containing the image and annotation file paths
 499
 500    Replaces the class names in the annotation files with a numerical representation.
 501
 502    The number is the index of the class name in the global list of implemented types.
 503    This is necessary, as the YOLO training process cannot deal with string representations of classes.
 504    """
 505    global implemented_types
 506    for i,(_, annotation) in enumerate(files):
 507        for a_class in implemented_types:
 508            replacement = str(implemented_types.index(a_class))
 509            with open(annotation, 'r+') as f:
 510                lines = f.readlines()
 511                for i, line in enumerate(lines):
 512                    line = line.replace(a_class + " ", replacement + " ")
 513                    lines[i] = line
 514                f.seek(0)
 515                f.writelines(lines)
 516                f.truncate()
 517
 518def shuffle_split(input: list, split_ratio: tuple):
 519    """
 520    **Params:**
 521    - `input` List of tuples containing the image and annotation file paths
 522    - `split_ratio` Tuple of three values that sum up to 1 (train, val, test)
 523
 524    Shuffles the provided input list and splits it into three parts based on the provided split ratio.
 525    The split ratio is a tuple of three values that sum up to 1.
 526    The first value is the ratio of the training set, the second value is the ratio of the validation set, and the third value is the ratio of the test set.
 527    """
 528    import random
 529    if len(split_ratio) != 3 or sum(split_ratio) != 1:
 530        raise ValueError("Split ratio must be a tuple of 3 values that sum up to 1. (e.g. (0.7, 0.1, 0.2))")
 531    random.shuffle(input)
 532    part1 = int(len(input) * split_ratio[0])
 533    part2 = int(len(input) * split_ratio[1])
 534    # NOTE Part3 is the remainder of the input
 535
 536    split1 = input[:part1]
 537    split2 = input[part1:part1 + part2]
 538    split3 = input[part1 + part2:]
 539    return (split1, split2, split3)
 540
 541def prepare_dataset(env: dict, args: argparse.Namespace):
 542    """
 543    **Params:**
 544    - `env` Environment dictionary containing the output folder and Micropython paths
 545    - `args` Arguments containing the type of generator and the split ratio
 546
 547    Prepares and organizes a dataset from the generated files.
 548
 549    The dataset is split into three parts based on the provided split ratio, otherwise a default split ratio of `(0.7, 0.1, 0.2)` is used.
 550    The dataset is organized into a folder structure that is compatible with the YOLO training process.
 551    Each dataset part (train, val, test) contains an image and a label folder, where the respective files will be moved after the shuffle split.
 552    The files will be renamed according to their destination folder and index in their partial list. (e.g. `[(train_0.jpg, train_0.txt), ...]`, `[(val_0.jpg, val_0.txt), ...]`, `[(test_0.jpg, test_0.txt), ...]`)
 553
 554    A dataset YAML file is created that contains the path to the dataset, the folder structure, and the class indexes with their names.
 555    If the no_dataset flag is set, the dataset will be uploaded as a ZIP archive artifact to the ClearML task.
 556    Otherwise, another function will take care of dataset creation within ClearML by re-using all task information.
 557    """
 558    import os, yaml, shutil
 559    from clearml import Task
 560    import numpy as np
 561    task = Task.current_task()
 562    global implemented_types
 563    train_img_dir = "images/train"
 564    train_label_dir = "labels/train"
 565    val_img_dir = "images/val"
 566    val_label_dir = "labels/val"
 567    test_img_dir = "images/test"
 568    test_label_dir = "labels/test"
 569    target_dir = os.path.join(env['output_folder'], args.type)
 570    dataset_file = os.path.abspath(os.path.join(env['output_folder'], args.type, f"{args.type}.yaml"))
 571    train_img_folder = os.path.join(target_dir, train_img_dir)
 572    train_label_folder = os.path.join(target_dir, train_label_dir)
 573    val_img_folder = os.path.join(target_dir, val_img_dir)
 574    val_label_folder = os.path.join(target_dir, val_label_dir)
 575    test_img_folder = os.path.join(target_dir, test_img_dir)
 576    test_label_folder = os.path.join(target_dir, test_label_dir)
 577    folders = [target_dir, train_img_folder, train_label_folder, val_img_folder, val_label_folder, test_img_folder, test_label_folder]
 578    # Prepare files
 579    replace_class_names(env['files'])
 580    split_ratio = args.split_ratio if args.split_ratio else (0.7, 0.1, 0.2)
 581    train_files, val_files, test_files = shuffle_split(env['files'], split_ratio)
 582    # Prepare folders
 583    for folder in folders[1:]: # NOTE Skip first element to not delete the target_dir (might contain extra data/folders)
 584        if os.path.exists(folder):
 585            shutil.rmtree(folder)
 586        os.makedirs(folder, exist_ok=True)
 587    # Move files
 588    for i, (image, annotation) in enumerate(train_files):
 589        print(f"Moving {image} -> {train_img_folder}/train_{i}.jpg")
 590        shutil.move(image, os.path.join(train_img_folder, f"train_{i}.jpg"))
 591        shutil.move(annotation, os.path.join(train_label_folder, f"train_{i}.txt"))
 592    for i, (image, annotation) in enumerate(val_files):
 593        print(f"Moving {image} -> {val_img_folder}/val_{i}.jpg")
 594        shutil.move(image, os.path.join(val_img_folder, f"val_{i}.jpg"))
 595        shutil.move(annotation, os.path.join(val_label_folder, f"val_{i}.txt"))
 596    for i, (image, annotation) in enumerate(test_files):
 597        print(f"Moving {image} -> {test_img_folder}/test_{i}.jpg")
 598        shutil.move(image, os.path.join(test_img_folder, f"test_{i}.jpg"))
 599        shutil.move(annotation, os.path.join(test_label_folder, f"test_{i}.txt"))
 600    # Create dataset YAML
 601    content = {
 602        'path': os.path.join(env['output_folder'], args.type),
 603        'train': train_img_dir,
 604        'val': val_img_dir,
 605        'test': test_img_dir,
 606        'names': implemented_types
 607    }
 608    with open(dataset_file, 'w') as f:
 609        yaml.dump(content, f)
 610    task.get_logger().report_histogram(title='Split (train, val, test)', series='total', values=np.array([[len(train_files)], [len(val_files)], [len(test_files)]]), labels=['Train', 'Validate', 'Test'], yaxis='File count')
 611    env['dataset_folder'] = target_dir
 612    env['metadata'] = {'Generator type': args.type, 'Split ratio': split_ratio, 'Total files': len(env['files']), 'Train': len(train_files), 'Validate': len(val_files), 'Test': len(test_files)}
 613    # Alternative artifact upload to task
 614    if args.no_dataset:
 615        task.upload_artifact('Dataset', target_dir, metadata=env['metadata'])
 616
 617def create_dataset(env: dict, args: argparse.Namespace):
 618    """
 619    **Params:**
 620    - `env` Environment dictionary containing the output folder and Micropython paths
 621    - `args` Arguments containing the type of generator and the dataset name
 622
 623    Creates a dataset within ClearML from the generated dataset files.
 624
 625    The dataset is created with the provided dataset name and the static project name "LVGL UI Detector".
 626    The dataset creation re-uses the current task information and uploads the dataset files to ClearML.
 627    This ensures, that all created files, statistics and metadata are available in the linked task of the dataset.
 628    The dataset is given a final comment, stating the dataset name and its ID.
 629
 630    After uploading, the dataset is finalized and cannot be modified anymore.
 631    """
 632    from clearml import Task, Dataset
 633    task = Task.current_task()
 634    if args.type == 'random':
 635        custom = f"(widgets={env['generated_widgets']},files={env['generated_files']})"
 636    else:
 637        custom = f"(files={env['generated_files']})"
 638    if not args.dataset:
 639        args.dataset = f"LVGL UI {custom}"
 640    else:
 641        args.dataset = f"{args.dataset} {custom}"
 642    task.rename(f"{args.type.upper()} UI Dataset")
 643    dataset = Dataset.create(dataset_name=args.dataset, dataset_project="LVGL UI Detector", use_current_task=True)
 644    dataset.add_files(env['dataset_folder'])
 645    dataset.upload()
 646    comment = f"Dataset '{args.dataset}' created: {dataset.id}"
 647    print(comment)
 648    dataset.set_metadata(env['metadata'])
 649    dataset.finalize()
 650    task.set_comment(comment)
 651
 652# Environment helpers
 653def prepare_task(args: dict):
 654    """
 655    **Params:**
 656    - `args` Dictionary containing the CLI arguments
 657
 658    Prepares a ClearML task, connecting the provided CLI arguments as task parameters.
 659
 660    The task is initialized with the project name "LVGL UI Detector" and the task name "UI Generator".
 661    The task type is set to "data_processing" and custom tags are set based on the provided arguments (generator type, model-variant, etc.)
 662    """
 663    from clearml import Task
 664    tags = ["lvgl-ui-detector", args.type]
 665    if args.type == 'design':
 666        tags.append(args.variant)
 667    task = Task.init(project_name='LVGL UI Detector', task_name=f'UI Generator', task_type=Task.TaskTypes.data_processing, tags=tags)
 668    task.connect(args)
 669
 670def prepare_environment(output_folder: str, mpy_path: str, mpy_main: str):
 671    """
 672    **Params:**
 673    - `output_folder` Path to the output folder
 674    - `mpy_path` Path to the Micropython binary
 675    - `mpy_main` Path to the main.py script of the LVGL UI Generator project
 676    
 677    **Returns:**
 678    - `dict` Environment dictionary containing the output folder, Micropython paths, and additional information
 679
 680    Prepares the environment dictionary for the generation process.
 681    The target output folder is created and the paths to the Micropython generator and main script are stored.
 682    The environment dictionary is returned for further usage.
 683    This dictionary will further be extended by other functions in the generation process, to store additional information.
 684    """
 685    import os
 686    env = {
 687        'output_folder': os.path.abspath(output_folder),
 688        'mpy_path': os.path.abspath(mpy_path),
 689        'mpy_main': os.path.abspath(mpy_main)
 690    }
 691    os.makedirs(env['output_folder'], exist_ok=True)
 692    return env
 693
 694# Design Mode helpers (for ChatGPT generation)
 695def load_json_file(filepath: str):
 696    """
 697    **Params:**
 698    - `filepath` Path to the JSON file to load
 699    
 700    **Returns:**
 701    - `dict` Python dictionary containing the JSON file content
 702
 703    Loads a JSON file from the provided file path and returns the content as a Python dictionary.
 704    """
 705    import json
 706    with open(filepath, 'r') as f:
 707        return json.load(f)
 708
 709def verify_design_from_file(design_file: str, schema_file: str) -> tuple[bool, Exception]:
 710    """
 711    **Params:**
 712    - `design_file` Path to the design file to verify
 713    - `schema_file` Path to the JSON schema file to use for validation
 714    
 715    **Returns:**
 716    - `tuple[bool, Exception]` Tuple containing a boolean value and an exception (if any)
 717
 718    Verifies the design file against the provided JSON schema file.
 719    The design file is loaded and validated against the schema, using the JSON schema library.
 720    If the design file is valid, the function returns True and None.
 721    If the design file is invalid, the function returns False and the exception that was raised during validation.
 722    """
 723    from jsonschema import validate
 724    from jsonschema.exceptions import ValidationError
 725    design = load_json_file(design_file)
 726    schema = load_json_file(schema_file)
 727    try:
 728        validate(instance=design, schema=schema)
 729        print(f"Provided design file {design_file} is valid.")
 730        return True, None
 731    except ValidationError as e:
 732        print(f"Provided design file {design_file} is invalid:\n{e}")
 733        return False, e
 734
 735def verify_design_from_string(design: str, schema_file: str) -> tuple[bool, Exception]:
 736    """
 737    **Params:**
 738    - `design` Design string to verify
 739    - `schema_file` Path to the JSON schema file to use for validation
 740    
 741    **Returns:**
 742    - `tuple[bool, Exception]` Tuple containing a boolean value and an exception (if any)
 743
 744    Verifies the provided design string against the provided JSON schema file.
 745    The design string is loaded and validated against the schema, using the JSON schema library.
 746    If the design string is valid, the function returns True and None.
 747    If the design string is invalid, the function returns False and the exception that was raised during validation.
 748    """
 749    from jsonschema import validate
 750    from jsonschema.exceptions import ValidationError
 751    schema = load_json_file(schema_file)
 752    try:
 753        validate(instance=design, schema=schema)
 754        return True, None
 755    except ValidationError as e:
 756        return False, e
 757
 758def count_design_widget_types(json_string, first: bool = True):
 759    """
 760    **Params:**
 761    - `json_string` JSON string containing the design to count the widget types from
 762    - `first` Flag indicating if this is the first call of the function
 763    
 764    **Returns:**
 765    - `dict` Dictionary containing the widget types and their occurrences
 766
 767    Counts the occurrences of each widget type in the provided JSON string.
 768
 769    The JSON string is loaded and parsed into a Python dictionary.
 770    The function iterates through each widget and counts the occurrences of each widget type.
 771    If a widget is a container, the layout type is also counted.
 772    The function is recursive and counts the widget types in the children of each widget.
 773    The function returns a dictionary with the widget types as keys and their occurrences as values.
 774    """
 775    import json
 776    # Load the JSON string into a Python dictionary
 777    data = json.loads(json_string)
 778    # Create a dictionary to count occurrences of each widget type
 779    type_count = {}
 780    if first:
 781        type_count[data['ui']['root']['type']] = 1
 782        widgets = data['ui']['root']['children']
 783    else:
 784        # If this is a recursive call, the 'children' list is directly passed
 785        widgets = data
 786    # Iterate through each widget and increment its type count in the dictionary
 787    for widget in widgets:
 788        widget_type = widget['type']
 789        if widget_type == 'container':
 790            type_count[widget['options']['layout_type']] = type_count.get(widget['options']['layout_type'], 0) + 1
 791        type_count[widget_type] = type_count.get(widget_type, 0) + 1
 792        if 'children' in widget:
 793            # Recursively count the widget types in the children of this widget
 794            child_type_count = count_design_widget_types(json.dumps(widget['children']), False)
 795            # Merge the child type counts into the main type count dictionary
 796            for child_type in child_type_count:
 797                type_count[child_type] = type_count.get(child_type, 0) + child_type_count[child_type]
 798    # Return the dictionary of widget type counts
 799    return type_count
 800
 801def ask_gpt(openai: dict):
 802    """
 803    **Params:**
 804    - `openai` Configuration dictionary for the OpenAI GPT API
 805    
 806    **Returns:**
 807    - `dict` Response dictionary from the OpenAI GPT API
 808
 809    Calls the OpenAI GPT API with the provided configuration.
 810
 811    The OpenAI API is used to generate a response based on the provided configuration.
 812    The response is returned to the caller.
 813    Used configurations are:
 814    - model: The model variant to use for the response generation.
 815    - messages: The messages to provide to the model for the response generation.
 816    - max_tokens: The maximum amount of tokens to generate in the response.
 817    - format: The format of the response to generate.
 818    - stop: The stop condition for the response generation. (Optional)
 819
 820    You may either use temperature or top_p for response generation, but not both as it is mutually exclusive.
 821    This is the recommended pattern by the OpenAI API.
 822    If neither are provided, the response generation will be done using the default temperature and top_p values, as stated in the OpenAI API documentation.
 823    """
 824    from openai import OpenAI
 825    client = OpenAI() # per-default uses api_key=os.environ['OPENAI_API_KEY']
 826    if 'temperature' in openai:
 827        response = client.chat.completions.create(
 828            model=openai['model'],
 829            messages=openai['messages'],
 830            max_tokens=openai['max_tokens'],
 831            response_format={"type": openai['format']},
 832            stop=openai['stop'] if 'stop' in openai else None,
 833            temperature=openai['temperature'],
 834        )
 835    elif 'top_p' in openai:
 836        response = client.chat.completions.create(
 837            model=openai['model'],
 838            messages=openai['messages'],
 839            max_tokens=openai['max_tokens'],
 840            response_format={"type": openai['format']},
 841            stop=openai['stop'] if 'stop' in openai else None,
 842            top_p=openai['top_p']
 843        )
 844    else:
 845        response = client.chat.completions.create(
 846            model=openai['model'],
 847            messages=openai['messages'],
 848            max_tokens=openai['max_tokens'],
 849            response_format={"type": openai['format']},
 850            stop=openai['stop'] if 'stop' in openai else None,
 851        )
 852    # TODO Return the response conditionally based on the choices made or none on failure
 853    return response
 854
 855def ask_gpt_for_design_idea(openai: dict):
 856    """
 857    **Params:**
 858    - `openai` Configuration dictionary for the OpenAI GPT API
 859    
 860    **Returns:**
 861    - `dict` Response from the OpenAI GPT API
 862
 863    Executes the `ask_gpt` function to generate a design idea, with the static system prompt for proper structure of the design idea output.
 864
 865    The OpenAI API is used to generate a response based on the provided configuration.
 866    A random chosen value from the combinated list of themes and topics is used as user prompt for the design idea.
 867    A chosen value is then removed from the list to avoid repetition.
 868    The list contains 10000 unique combinations of UI contexts and themes.
 869    The system prompt is designed, so that the design idea will follow a specific structure and contain necessary information in regards to the LVGL UI generator.
 870    The response is returned to the caller.
 871    """
 872    import random
 873    from datetime import datetime
 874    random.seed(datetime.now().timestamp())
 875    # NOTE Shuffle themes and topics to randomize selection
 876    random.shuffle(combinations)
 877    theme_topic = random.choice(combinations)
 878    # NOTE Remove the used theme and topic to avoid repetition
 879    combinations.remove(theme_topic)
 880    theme, topic = theme_topic
 881    system_message = """
 882You are a UI designer.
 883Your goal is to create a new design idea and guideline for an user interface to be given to developers.
 884The user will ask for a new design to be created.
 885You will imagine a new user interface and provide a detailed description of the design.
 886Make sure to include the following in your design idea:
 887- A title for the design
 888- The context of the design
 889- The visual theme of the design
 890- A list of style groups
 891- A list of used widgets, including their purpose and style
 892- A high-level description of the design
 893
 894You must adhere to these constraints and rules.
 895
 896DESIGN RULES:
 897In the idea, you will include mentions of design elements that should be present in the form of widgets.
 898These are the allowed widget types to be used as design elements and their corresponding purposes:
 899- Arc: A circular arc to select or display a value within a range
 900- Bar: A horizontal or vertical bar to select or display a value within a range
 901- Button: Clickable button with or without text
 902- ButtonMatrix: Matrix of buttons with or without text
 903- Calendar: A calendar showing the month with or without highlighted dates
 904- Checkbox: A box that can be checked or unchecked
 905- Dropdown: A box containing multiple options as entries where one can be selected
 906- Label: A field for text display
 907- Roller: A special dropdown with a rolling interface for selecting entries
 908- Scale: A scale for displaying a range of values
 909- Slider: A slider for selecting a value within a range
 910- Spinbox: Spinbox widget
 911- Switch: A switch for toggling between two states
 912- Table: A tabular widget for displaying data
 913- TextArea: A field for input or display of multiple text lines
 914- Container: A special widget containing other widgets in a structured layout
 915
 916Design elements can be structurally combined using the special widget 'container'.
 917These special widgets must have an 'id' attribute to be referenced by other widgets.
 918The structure of such a container may be defined as a layout of the following types and purposes:
 919- none: Widgets are structured using absolute positioning (Widgets placed in the container must be positioned using a specific style group that defines their X and Y coordinates)
 920- flex: Widgets are structured in a flexible layout that adjusts to the available space horizontally or vertically (using flex_flow: row, column, row_wrap, column_wrap, row_reverse, column_reverse)
 921Widget sizes must avoid overlap with other widgets and can be controlled by setting width and height in a style group.
 922
 923Design elements can be styled individually or identically using a style group.
 924Style groups define a set of style properties that are applied to the widgets that use them.
 925The style properties include color, size, padding, margin, opacity, border, lines, shadows and more.
 926The style groups are named using a unique identifier.
 927A widget may have multiple styles applied to it, and a style group may be applied to multiple widgets.
 928
 929ALLOWED STYLE PROPERTIES:
 930These properties are applicable to style groups and can be used to define the appearance of widgets.
 931- bg_color: Background color of the widget
 932- bg_opa: Opacity of the background color of the widget
 933- border_color: Color of the border of the widget
 934- border_opa: Opacity of the border of the widget
 935- border_width: Width of the border of the widget
 936- outline_width: Width of the outline of the widget
 937- outline_color: Color of the outline of the widget
 938- outline_opa: Opacity of the outline of the widget
 939- shadow_width: Width of the shadow of the widget
 940- shadow_offset_x: Horizontal offset of the shadow of the widget
 941- shadow_offset_y: Vertical offset of the shadow of the widget
 942- shadow_color: Color of the shadow of the widget
 943- shadow_opa: Opacity of the shadow of the widget
 944- line_width: Width of the line of the widget
 945- line_dash_width: Width of the dashes of the line of the widget
 946- line_dash_gap: Gap between the dashes of the line of the widget
 947- line_rounded: A boolean representing if the line of the widget is rounded
 948- line_color: Color of the line of the widget
 949- line_opa: Opacity of the line of the widget
 950- arc_width: Width of the arc widget
 951- arc_color: Color of the arc widget
 952- arc_opa: Opacity of the arc widget
 953- arc_rounded: A boolean representing if the arc widget is rounded
 954- text_color: Color of the text of the widget
 955- text_opa: Opacity of the text of the widget
 956- text_letter_space: Letter space of the text of the widget
 957- text_line_space: Line space of the text of the widget
 958- opa: Opacity of the widget itself
 959- align: Alignment of the widget
 960- x: X position of the widget
 961- y: Y position of the widget
 962- min_width: Minimum width of the widget
 963- min_height: Minimum height of the widget
 964- max_width: Maximum width of the widget
 965- max_height: Maximum height of the widget
 966- length: Length of the widget
 967- pad_all: Padding of the widget on all sides
 968- pad_hor: Horizontal padding of the widget
 969- pad_ver: Vertical padding of the widget
 970- pad_gap: Gap between the padding of the widget
 971- pad_top: Top padding of the widget
 972- pad_bottom: Bottom padding of the widget
 973- pad_left: Left padding of the widget
 974- pad_right: Right padding of the widget
 975- pad_row: Padding of the widget on the row
 976- pad_column: Padding of the widget on the column
 977- margin_top: Top margin of the widget
 978- margin_bottom: Bottom margin of the widget
 979- margin_left: Left margin of the widget
 980- margin_right: Right margin of the widget
 981
 982CONSTRAINT:
 983- A design must always be a visually complete representation of a single window, ignoring any possible interactions of the user interface.
 984Think of the design as a static image that represents the final appearance of the user interface in a single frame.
 985- The size of the window must be 640 x 640 pixels.
 986- Font is not a design element, so you do not need to specify font styles or sizes.
 987- The design idea is targeting the LVGL library
 988
 989TASK:
 990It is your task to create a design idea for a user interface that adheres to these design rules and constraints.
 991You will be given a random topic and theme to base your design idea on.
 992Try to incorporate as many varied widgets as possible in the design.
 993"""
 994# NOTE Removed the following constraints to simplify the task
 995# """
 996# - grid: Widgets are structured in rows and columns, each cell containing a widget
 997# """
 998    initial_prompt = f"""
 999Create a new UI design about '{topic}' in the theme of '{theme}'.
1000"""
1001    openai['messages'] = [
1002        {"role": "system", "content": system_message},
1003        {"role": "user", "content": initial_prompt}
1004    ]
1005    openai['format'] = "text"
1006    # Get response
1007    response = ask_gpt(openai)
1008    return response.choices[0].message.content
1009
1010def ask_gpt_for_design_json(openai: dict, design: dict):
1011    """
1012    **Params:**
1013    - `openai` Configuration dictionary for the OpenAI GPT API
1014    - `design` Design dictionary containing the design idea and previous validation errors
1015    
1016    **Returns:**
1017    - `tuple[bool, str, Exception]` Tuple containing a boolean value, the generated JSON design and an exception (if any)
1018
1019    Executes the `ask_gpt` function to generate a JSON design from the provided design idea.
1020
1021    The OpenAI API is used to generate a response based on the provided configuration.
1022    The design idea is provided as user input to the model for the response generation.
1023    The system prompt is designed, so that the output JSON will follow special rules and constraints for the LVGL UI generator.
1024    Additionally, the design schema is added to the system prompt, as formal specification guidance for the JSON output.
1025    The JSON response is validated against the schema after generation.
1026    If the provided design dictionary contains validation errors from previous attempts, the last error is provided as additional user prompt for GPT to correct.
1027    The response is returned to the caller for further processing.
1028    """
1029    import os, json
1030    schema_file = os.path.join(os.path.curdir, 'schema', 'design_file.schema.json')
1031    openai['schema'] = json.load(open(schema_file, 'r'))
1032    system_message = """
1033You are a UI generator.
1034Your goal is to create a new single window UI using a specialized JSON format.
1035The format specification is available in the design.schema.json file below.
1036Follow the provided design guideline of the user when replicating the design idea using the structure of the JSON format.
1037Always output a valid JSON object that represents the UI design.
1038
1039You ALSO MUST adhere to the following SPECIAL RULES:
1040- Never use 'grid' container. Use either 'none' or 'flex' container.
1041- Containers must be used to set style for the whole window or the specific group of widgets (such as background color and other general styles).
1042- Each widget placed inside a 'none' container must have an associated style defining its X and Y coordinates.
1043- Widgets may have multiple styles applied to them
1044- Window size MUST be 640 x 640 pixels
1045- You MUST make sure that coordinates of widgets do not overlap due to width and height of the widgets
1046- You MUST make sure that the widgets are within the window bounds (0, 0, 640, 640)
1047    """
1048# NOTE Removing the use of grid containers, since they are too complicated to get a good looking result
1049# '''
1050# You ALSO MUST adhere to the following SPECIAL RULES:
1051# - If a widget is under the 'children' property of a container AND the container is of layout_type 'grid', then those children must have the 'placement' property.
1052# This also applies to nested containers within the 'children' property of a container.
1053# This placement property must adhere to the following schema:
1054# "placement": {
1055#     "type": "object",
1056#     "properties": {
1057#         "col_pos": { "type": "integer" },
1058#         "col_span": { "type": "integer" },
1059#         "row_pos": { "type": "integer" },
1060#         "row_span": { "type": "integer" }
1061#     },
1062#     "required": ["col_pos", "col_span", "row_pos", "row_span"]
1063# }
1064# - The window size defined under the 'window' object MUST be square. (equal width and height)
1065# - Container widgets must have an associated 'style' which defines their HEIGHT and WIDTH.
1066# '''
1067    system_message += f"\ndesign.schema.json:\n{str(openai['schema'])}"
1068    initial_prompt = "Create a new user interface for this design idea:\n"
1069    if len(design['errors']) == 0:
1070        openai['messages'] = [
1071            {"role": "system", "content": system_message},
1072            {"role": "user", "content": initial_prompt + design['idea']},
1073        ]
1074    else:
1075        # NOTE This is a bit of a hack using only the last error message (which might result in error repetition)
1076        error_prompt = "The design has validation errors:\n" + str(design['errors'][-1]) + "\nCorrect ALL errors and generate a complete JSON output."
1077        openai['messages'] = [
1078            {"role": "system", "content": system_message},
1079            {"role": "user", "content": initial_prompt + design['idea']},
1080            {"role": "assistant", "content": design['json_raw']},
1081            {"role": "user", "content": error_prompt}
1082        ]
1083    openai['format'] = "json_object"
1084    # Get response
1085    response = ask_gpt(openai)
1086    json_design = response.choices[0].message.content
1087    json_file = os.path.join(env['design_folder'], f'attempts', f"design_{design['iteration']}_{design['attempts']}.json")
1088    with open(json_file, 'w') as f:
1089        f.write(json_design)
1090    # Check if response is valid JSON
1091    is_valid, error = verify_design_from_file(json_file, schema_file)
1092    return is_valid, json_design, error
1093
1094def generate_designs(env: dict, args: argparse.Namespace):
1095    """
1096    **Params:**
1097    - `env` Environment dictionary containing the output folder and Micropython paths
1098    - `args` Arguments containing the design type, model variant, and design count
1099
1100    Generates UI designs based on the provided configuration and arguments.
1101    The OpenAI API is used to generate design ideas and JSON designs.
1102
1103    **First**, a design idea is generated using the `ask_gpt_for_design_idea` function.
1104    The LLM is prompted with a randomly chosen combination of the `themes` and `topics`  to generate a design idea.
1105    Once chosen, the theme and topic are removed from the `combinations` list to avoid repetition.
1106    The design idea is saved to a markdown file for reference in the created `attempts` folder.
1107
1108    **Then**, a JSON design is generated using the `ask_gpt_for_design_json` function.
1109    The created JSON design is saved as an attempt file for reference.
1110    The JSON file is then validated against the design schema to ensure its correctness.
1111    If it contains errors, the validation error is saved to a file for reference.
1112    Any validation errors are looped back to another attempt to generate a valid JSON design.
1113    Any design idea will be attempted to generate a valid JSON design up to 3 times.
1114    This limit is set to avoid infinite costs incurred through the OpenAI API usage.
1115
1116    The widget types of the generated designs are counted and reported to the ClearML task.
1117    The total widget count is reported as a histogram, showing the distribution of widget types in the generated designs.
1118    All valid design files are saved to the output folder for further processing and usage in the dataset generation.
1119    """
1120    import os
1121    from clearml import Task
1122    import numpy as np
1123    # TODO should connect stuff to ClearML task
1124    task = Task.current_task()
1125    task.add_tags([args.variant, args.model])
1126    logger = task.get_logger()
1127    open_ai = {}
1128    env['design_folder'] = os.path.join(args.output_folder, args.type, 'designs')
1129    os.makedirs(env['design_folder'], exist_ok=True)
1130    os.makedirs(os.path.join(env['design_folder'], 'attempts'), exist_ok=True)
1131    open_ai['model'] = args.model
1132    open_ai['max_tokens'] = args.max_tokens
1133    if hasattr(args, 'temperature'):
1134        open_ai['temperature'] = args.temperature
1135    elif hasattr(args, 'top_p'):
1136        open_ai['top_p'] = args.top_p
1137    total_widget_count = {}
1138    open_ai['valid_designs'] = 0
1139    for i in range(args.designs):
1140        print(f"Generating design {i}...")
1141        valid_design = False
1142        design = {}
1143        design['attempts'] = 0
1144        design['errors'] = []
1145        design['iteration'] = i
1146        design['idea'] = ask_gpt_for_design_idea(open_ai)
1147        with open(os.path.join(env['design_folder'], f'attempts', f"design_{i}_idea.md"), 'w') as f:
1148            f.write(design['idea'])
1149        while not valid_design and design['attempts'] < 3: # NOTE Limiting attempts (to avoid infinite costs for now)
1150            valid_design, design['json_raw'], error = ask_gpt_for_design_json(open_ai, design)
1151            if error:
1152                design['errors'].append(error)
1153                print(f"JSON generation failed with error.")
1154                with open(os.path.join(env['design_folder'], f'attempts', f"design_{i}_errors.txt"), 'a') as f:
1155                    f.write(f"\nAttempt {design['attempts']}:\n")
1156                    f.write(str(error))
1157                design['attempts'] += 1
1158        else:
1159            logger.report_scalar(title='GPT Designer', series='errors', value=len(design['errors']), iteration=i+1)
1160            if valid_design:
1161                print(f"Generated valid design after {design['attempts'] + 1} attempts")
1162                open_ai['valid_designs'] += 1
1163            else:
1164                print(f"Failed to generate valid design after {design['attempts'] + 1} attempts")
1165                continue
1166        # print(f"Design JSON:\n{design['json_raw']}")
1167        design['file'] = os.path.join(env['design_folder'], f"design_{i}.json")
1168        with open(design['file'], 'w') as f:
1169            f.write(design['json_raw'])
1170        # Count widget types
1171        widget_count = count_design_widget_types(design['json_raw'])
1172        logger.report_scalar(title='GPT Designer', series='total_widgets', value=sum(widget_count.values()), iteration=i+1)
1173        for widget in widget_count:
1174            logger.report_scalar(title='GPT Designer', series=widget, value=widget_count[widget], iteration=i+1)
1175            if widget not in total_widget_count:
1176                total_widget_count[widget] = widget_count[widget]
1177            else:
1178                total_widget_count[widget] += widget_count[widget]
1179        open_ai[f'design_{i}'] = design
1180    env['OPEN_AI'] = open_ai
1181    generated_widgets = sum(total_widget_count.values())
1182    generated_designs = open_ai['valid_designs']
1183    histogram_values = np.array([[generated_widgets], [generated_designs]] + [[value] for value in total_widget_count.values()])
1184    histogram_labels = ['Widgets', 'Designs'] + [key for key in total_widget_count.keys()]
1185    logger.report_histogram(title='Generated', series='total', values=histogram_values, labels=histogram_labels, yaxis='Count')
1186
1187# CLI helpers (used for argparse to show help for subparsers)
1188class _HelpAction(argparse._HelpAction):
1189    # Source: https://stackoverflow.com/a/24122778
1190    def __call__(self, parser, namespace, values, option_string=None):
1191        parser.print_help()
1192
1193        # retrieve subparsers from parser
1194        subparsers_actions = [
1195            action for action in parser._actions
1196            if isinstance(action, argparse._SubParsersAction)]
1197        # there will probably only be one subparser_action,
1198        # but better save than sorry
1199        for subparsers_action in subparsers_actions:
1200            # get all subparsers and print help
1201            for choice, subparser in subparsers_action.choices.items():
1202                print("Subparser '{}'".format(choice))
1203                print(subparser.format_help())
1204
1205        parser.exit()
1206
1207def cli_parser():
1208    """
1209    Creates the CLI parser for the UI Detector dataset generation script.
1210    The parser includes arguments for the output folder, Micropython paths, dataset name, split ratio and dataset creation.
1211    Additionally, subparsers are added for the different UI generation types (random, design) and their respective arguments.
1212    """
1213    parser = argparse.ArgumentParser(description='Generate UI Detector dataset', add_help=False, formatter_class=argparse.ArgumentDefaultsHelpFormatter)
1214    parser.add_argument('-h', '--help', action=_HelpAction, help='show this help message and exit') # add custom help
1215    parser.add_argument('-o', '--output-folder', type=str, default='tmp/output', help='Output folder')
1216    parser.add_argument('--mpy-path', type=str, default='', help='Path to MicroPython binary (loads from environment MICROPYTHON_BIN if not provided)')
1217    parser.add_argument('--mpy-main', type=str, default='', help='Path to main.py of micropython script (loads from environment MICROPYTHON_MAIN if not provided)')
1218    parser.add_argument('-d', '--dataset', type=str, default='', help='Custom name of the dataset written in the task comment')
1219    parser.add_argument('-s', '--split-ratio', type=int, nargs=3, default=None, help='Split ratio for train, val, test')
1220    parser.add_argument('--no-dataset', action='store_true', help='Do not create a ClearML dataset (artifacts are added to Task)')
1221    type = parser.add_subparsers(dest='type', help='Type of LVGL UI generator to use')
1222    random_gen = type.add_parser('random', help='Generate random UI')
1223    random_gen.add_argument('-W', '--width', type=int, default=250, help='Width of the UI screenshot')
1224    random_gen.add_argument('-H', '--height', type=int, default=250, help='Height of the UI screenshot')
1225    random_gen.add_argument('-c', '--count', type=int, default=3, help='Number of widgets to create per output')
1226    random_gen.add_argument('-l', '--layout', type=str, default='none', help='The main container layout of the random UI ["grid", "flex", "none"]')
1227    random_gen.add_argument('-x', '--amount', type=int, default=50, help='Amount of outputs per widget class to create')
1228    design_gen = type.add_parser('design', help='Generate UI from design files')
1229    design_variant = design_gen.add_subparsers(dest='variant', help='Variant of design generator to use')
1230    design_local = design_variant.add_parser('local', help='Generate UIs from local design files')
1231    design_local.add_argument('-f', '--design-folder', type=str, help='Source folder for design generator')
1232    design_remote = design_variant.add_parser('remote', help='Generate UIs from remote design files')
1233    # TODO Add arguments for remote design generator
1234    design_gpt = design_variant.add_parser('gpt', help='Generate UIs using ChatGPT API')
1235    design_gpt.add_argument('--api-key', type=str, default='', help='ChatGPT API key')
1236    design_gpt.add_argument('--model', type=str, required=True, help='ChatGPT model name')
1237    design_gpt.add_argument('--max-tokens', type=int, default=2500, help=f'ChatGPT maximum tokens') # TODO Check what would be sensible amount of default tokens
1238    design_gpt.add_argument('--designs', type=int, default=10, help='Number of designs to generate')
1239    gpt_arg = design_gpt.add_mutually_exclusive_group()
1240    gpt_arg.add_argument('--temperature', type=float, default=0.7, help='ChatGPT sampling temperature')
1241    gpt_arg.add_argument('--top-p', type=float, default=1.0, help='ChatGPT top-p sampling')
1242    return parser
1243
1244def validate_cli_args(args: dict):
1245    """
1246    **Params:**
1247    - `args` Dictionary containing the CLI arguments
1248
1249    Validates the provided CLI arguments and environment variables.
1250
1251    The function checks if a micropython path and script were provided. If not, it checks for existance in the environment variables.
1252    If the paths are not provided or do not exist, the function prints an error message and exits the script.
1253    Additionally, the function checks for the design folder in case of a local design generator and prints an error if it is not provided.
1254    If the GPT design generator is used, the function checks for the API key and model name and prints an error if they are not provided.
1255    """
1256    import os, sys
1257    has_error = False # NOTE Uses flag to check for multiple argument errors at once and then exit (more useful when running as task)
1258    if not args.mpy_path:
1259        if 'MICROPYTHON_BIN' in os.environ:
1260            args.mpy_path = os.environ['MICROPYTHON_BIN']
1261        else:
1262            print('MicroPython path not provided and MICROPYTHON_BIN environment variable not set')
1263            has_error = True
1264    if not args.mpy_main:
1265        if 'MICROPYTHON_MAIN' in os.environ:
1266            args.mpy_main = os.environ['MICROPYTHON_MAIN']
1267        else:
1268            print('MicroPython main.py path not provided and MICROPYTHON_MAIN environment variable not set')
1269            has_error = True
1270    if not os.path.exists(args.mpy_path):
1271        print(f'MicroPython path {args.mpy_path} does not exist')
1272        has_error = True
1273    if not os.path.exists(args.mpy_main):
1274        print(f'MicroPython main.py path {args.mpy_main} does not exist')
1275        has_error = True
1276    if args.type == 'design' and args.variant == 'local':
1277        if not args.design_folder:
1278            print('Design folder not provided for local design generator')
1279            has_error = True
1280    if args.type == 'design' and args.variant == 'remote':
1281        # TODO Add validation for remote design generator
1282        raise NotImplementedError("Remote design generator not implemented yet")
1283        pass
1284    if args.type == 'design' and args.variant == 'gpt':
1285        if not args.api_key and 'OPENAI_API_KEY' not in os.environ:
1286            print('ChatGPT API key not provided')
1287            has_error = True
1288        if not args.model:
1289            print('ChatGPT model name not provided')
1290            has_error = True
1291    if has_error:
1292        sys.exit(1)
1293
1294if __name__ == '__main__':
1295    parser = cli_parser()
1296    args = parser.parse_args()
1297    prepare_task(args)
1298    validate_cli_args(args)
1299    env = prepare_environment(args.output_folder, args.mpy_path, args.mpy_main)
1300    if args.type == 'random':
1301        capture_random(env, args)
1302    elif args.type == 'design':
1303        if args.variant == 'local':
1304            capture_design(args.design_folder)
1305        elif args.variant == 'remote':
1306            pass
1307        elif args.variant == 'gpt':
1308            try:
1309                generate_designs(env, args)
1310            except KeyboardInterrupt as e:
1311                print("Aborted design generation.")
1312            capture_design(env['design_folder'])
1313    prepare_dataset(env, args)
1314    if not args.no_dataset:
1315        create_dataset(env, args)
topics = ['Smart Home Control Systems', 'Wearable Fitness Trackers', 'Automotive Dashboard Displays', 'Industrial Automation Interfaces', 'Agricultural Monitoring Systems', 'Medical Device Interfaces', 'Drone Control Panels', 'Retail Point of Sale Systems', 'Smart Watches Interfaces', 'Security System Controls', 'Marine Navigation Systems', 'Building Climate Control Systems', 'Home Appliance Controls (e.g., Smart Refrigerators)', 'Energy Management Displays', 'Portable Music Players', 'Electronic Thermostats', 'Educational Tablets for Kids', 'Emergency Alert Systems', 'Water Purification System Controls', 'Lighting Control Systems', 'Portable Gaming Devices', 'Smart Mirror Technologies', 'Elevator Control Panels', 'Vending Machine Interfaces', 'Fitness Equipment Consoles', 'Industrial Robot Controllers', 'Smart Bed Controls', 'Smart Glasses Interfaces', 'Pet Tracking Devices', 'Baby Monitoring Systems', 'Digital Signage', 'Ticketing Kiosks', 'Virtual Reality Headset Interfaces', 'Library Management Kiosks', 'Smart Lock Interfaces', 'Laboratory Equipment Interfaces', 'Smart Pens', 'Art Installation Controls', 'HVAC Control Systems', 'Railroad Monitoring Systems', 'Handheld GPS Devices', 'Digital Cameras', 'Smart Toothbrushes', 'Aircraft Cockpit Displays', 'Electric Vehicle Charging Stations', 'Soil Moisture Sensors', 'Smart Jewelry', 'Pipeline Monitoring Systems', 'Waste Management Systems', 'Personal Medical Devices (e.g., Insulin Pumps)', 'Public Transportation Displays', 'On-board Ship Computers', 'Smart Plant Pots', 'Industrial Pressure Sensors', 'Interactive Museum Exhibits', 'Smart Bicycle Systems', 'Conference Room Booking Displays', 'Augmented Reality Interfaces', 'Remote Wilderness Cameras', 'Interactive Retail Displays', 'Spacecraft Control Interfaces', 'Wireless Router Management', 'Smart City Infrastructure Interfaces', 'Factory Assembly Line Displays', 'Car Rental Kiosks', 'Airport Check-in Kiosks', 'Digital Billboards', 'Hospital Room Information Panels', 'Power Grid Monitoring Systems', 'Oil Rig Monitoring Interfaces', 'Smart Suitcases', 'Fishing Gear Electronics', 'Underwater Exploration Devices', 'Digital Menu Boards in Restaurants', 'Emergency Vehicle Dashboards', 'Voice-Controlled Home Assistants', 'Smart Coasters (beverage temperature)', 'Bicycle Sharing System Terminals', 'Smart Shower Panels', 'Mining Equipment Interfaces', 'Forest Fire Detection Systems', 'Smart Windows', 'Interactive Dance Floors', 'Smart Ring Interfaces', 'Professional Camera Systems', 'Home Brewing Systems', 'Smart Mailboxes', 'Autonomous Farm Equipment', 'Wind Turbine Controls', 'Smart Blinds and Curtains', 'Logistics Tracking Systems', 'Parking Garage Equipment', 'Smart Helmet Displays', 'Boat Instrumentation Panels', 'Interactive Park Equipment', 'Livestock Tracking Systems', 'Remote Surgery Consoles', 'Weather Monitoring Stations', 'Smart Gloves', 'Electronic Voting Machines']

100 topics that an embedded user interface could be about. It was generated using the GPT model from OpenAI with the prompt "Create a list of 100 topics that an embedded user interface could be about."

themes = [' Minimalist', 'Futuristic', 'Retro', 'High Contrast', 'Dark Mode', 'Light Mode', 'Nature-inspired', 'Nautical', 'Neon Glow', 'Earthy Tones', 'Pastel Colors', 'High Tech', 'Art Deco', 'Steampunk', 'Material Design', 'Flat Design', '3D Depth', 'Monochrome', 'Kids-Friendly', 'Elderly-Friendly', 'Luxury', 'Industrial', 'Sports', 'Educational', 'Seasonal (e.g., Winter, Summer)', 'Holiday Themes (e.g., Christmas, Halloween)', 'Cartoon', 'Abstract', 'Photorealistic', 'Geometric', 'Military', 'Space Exploration', 'Underwater', 'Urban', 'Rural', 'Health Focused', 'Accessibility Enhanced', 'Cultural (e.g., Japanese, Mexican)', 'Cyberpunk', 'Virtual Reality', 'Augmented Reality', 'Transparent Interfaces', 'Glass Effect', 'Vintage Film', 'Comic Book', 'Parchment and Ink', 'Origami', 'Glow in the Dark', 'Neon Signs', 'Hand-drawn', 'Watercolor', 'Grunge', 'Metallic', 'Zen and Tranquility', 'Casino', 'Outer Space', 'Sci-Fi', 'Historical Periods (e.g., Victorian, Medieval)', 'Typography-Based', 'Animal Print', 'Floral', 'Ocean Waves', 'Desert Sands', 'Mountainous Terrain', 'Tropical Paradise', 'Arctic Freeze', 'Jungle Theme', 'Auto Racing', 'Aviation', 'Sailing', 'Rock and Roll', 'Hip Hop', 'Classical Music', 'Opera', 'Ballet', 'Theatre', 'Film Noir', 'Silent Film', 'Neon Jungle', 'Crystal Clear', 'Witchcraft and Wizardry', 'Steampunk Mechanisms', 'Pop Art', 'Renaissance Art', 'Graffiti', 'Pixel Art', 'ASCII Art', 'Mosaic', 'Lego Style', 'Board Game', 'Video Game', 'Dystopian', 'Utopian', 'Western', 'Eastern', 'Minimalist Text', 'Bold Color Blocks', 'Line Art', 'Optical Illusions', 'Neon Abstract']

100 themes that could be applied to user interfaces. It was generated using the GPT model from OpenAI with the prompt "Create a list of 100 themes that could be applied to user interfaces."

combinations = [(' Minimalist', 'Smart Home Control Systems'), (' Minimalist', 'Wearable Fitness Trackers'), (' Minimalist', 'Automotive Dashboard Displays'), (' Minimalist', 'Industrial Automation Interfaces'), (' Minimalist', 'Agricultural Monitoring Systems'), (' Minimalist', 'Medical Device Interfaces'), (' Minimalist', 'Drone Control Panels'), (' Minimalist', 'Retail Point of Sale Minimalist', 'Wind Turbine Controls'), (' Minimalist', 'Smart Blinds and Curtains'), (' Minimalist', 'Logistics Tracking Systems'), (' Minimalist', 'Parking Garage Equipment'), (' Minimalist', 'Smart Helmet Displays'), (' Minimalist', 'Boat Instrumentation Panels'), (' Minimalist', 'Interactive Park Equipment'), (' Minimalist', 'Livestock Tracking Systems'), (' Minimalist', 'Remote Surgery Consoles'), (' Minimalist', 'Weather Monitoring Stations'), (' Minimalist', 'Smart Gloves'), (' Minimalist', 'Electronic Voting Machines'), ('Futuristic', 'Smart Home Control Systems'), ('Futuristic', 'Wearable Fitness Trackers'), ('Futuristic', 'Automotive Dashboard Displays'), ('Futuristic', 'Industrial Automation Interfaces'), ('Futuristic', 'Agricultural Monitoring Systems'), ('Futuristic',
